intro: Ceratolobus discolor, commonly known as the white-flowered burr bush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive seed pods. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Its seed pods are woody and often have a hooked or barbed structure, aiding in seed dispersal by attaching to animals. Ceratolobus discolor is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
